content:
TITLE: Converting PHP Template to Twig Template - Basic Structure DESCRIPTION: Complete example showing how to migrate a PHP template to Twig, including template extension, slots, routing, forms, and page actions. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-PHP-TO-TWIG-TEMPLATES.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` extend('MauticCoreBundle:Default:content.html.php'); $view['slots']->set('mauticContent', 'mauticWebhook'); $view['slots']->set('headerTitle', $view['translator']->trans('mautic.webhook.webhooks')); ?> // ROUTING // FORMS start($form); ?> row($form['email']); ?> end($form); ?> // PAGE ACTIONS $view['slots']->set('actions', $view->render('MauticCoreBundle:Helper:page_actions.html.php', [ 'item' => $item, 'templateButtons' => [ 'edit' => $view['security']->hasEntityAccess($permissions['webhook:webhooks:editown'], $permissions['webhook:webhooks:editother'], $item->getCreatedBy()), 'clone' => $permissions['webhook:webhooks:create'], 'delete' => $view['security']->hasEntityAccess($permissions['webhook:webhooks:deleteown'], $permissions['webhook:webhooks:deleteown'], $item->getCreatedBy()), ], 'routeBase' => 'webhook', ])); // TODO add more examples ``` LANGUAGE: Twig CODE: ``` {% extends '@MauticCore/Default/content.html.twig' %} {% block headerTitle %}{% trans %}mautic.webhook.webhooks{% endtrans %}{% endblock %} {% block mauticContent %}mauticWebhook{% endblock %} {# ROUTING #} Hello world! {# FORMS #} {{ form_start(form) }} {{ form_row(form.email) }} {{ form_end(form) }} {# PAGE ACTIONS #} {% block actions %} {{- include( '@MauticCore/Helper/page_actions.html.twig', { item: item, templateButtons: { 'edit': securityHasEntityAccess( permissions['webhook:webhooks:editown'], permissions['webhook:webhooks:editother'], item.getCreatedBy() ), 'clone': permissions['webhook:webhooks:create'], 'delete': securityHasEntityAccess( permissions['webhook:webhooks:deleteown'], permissions['webhook:webhooks:deleteother'], item.getCreatedBy() ) }, routeBase: 'webhook' }) -}} {% endblock %} {# TODO add more examples #} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Mautic with DDEV DESCRIPTION: Command for starting Mautic using DDEV, which automatically installs dependencies and configures Mautic for use. DDEV is a local development environment tool that simplifies the setup process. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ddev start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative DDEV Installation Commands DESCRIPTION: Alternative commands for configuring and starting Mautic with DDEV. This two-step process first configures DDEV for the Mautic project and then starts it to automatically install dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ddev config ``` LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` ddev start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Programmatic Integration Sync in PHP DESCRIPTION: PHP implementation for pushing specific Mautic contacts to an integration using the SyncService. This can be used in campaigns, forms, or point actions. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/app/bundles/IntegrationsBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: php CODE: ``` $mauticObjectIds = new \Mautic\IntegrationsBundle\Sync\DAO\Sync\ObjectIdsDAO(); $mauticObjectIds->addObjectId('contact', '12'); $mauticObjectIds->addObjectId('contact', '13'); $inputOptions = new Mautic\IntegrationsBundle\Sync\DAO\Sync\InputOptionsDAO( [ 'integration' => 'Magento', 'disable-pull' => true, 'mautic-object-id' => $mauticObjectIds, ] ); /** @var \Mautic\IntegrationsBundle\Sync\SyncService\SyncServiceInterface $syncService **/ $syncService->processIntegrationSync($inputOptions); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing HTTP Client in Mautic Service Class DESCRIPTION: Example of implementing the HTTP client in a service class using PSR-18 ClientInterface. Demonstrates proper dependency injection pattern for HTTP client usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-4.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` use Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface; .... public function __construct( ClientInterface $client ) { $this->client = $client; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring HTTP Client Service in Mautic DESCRIPTION: Example of configuring a service class to use Mautic's HTTP client through dependency injection in config.php. Shows how to register a service with the HTTP client as a dependency. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-4.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` 'mautic.demo.class' => [ 'class' => DemoClass::class, 'arguments' => [ 'mautic.http.client', ], ], ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Integration Sync Command DESCRIPTION: Standard sync command for Magento integration that syncs all new records bidirectionally between Mautic and the CRM without date parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/app/bundles/IntegrationsBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ bin/console mautic:integrations:sync Magento ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Selective Object Sync Command DESCRIPTION: Command for syncing specific Mautic contacts to an integration with pull disabled, demonstrating object-specific sync capabilities. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/app/bundles/IntegrationsBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ bin/console mautic:integrations:sync Magento --disable-pull --mautic-object-id=contact:12 --mautic-object-id=contact:13 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Integration Sync Command for First-time Setup DESCRIPTION: Example command for initializing sync between Mautic and a CRM integration (Magento) for the first time, with date parameters to control batch size. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/app/bundles/IntegrationsBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ bin/console mautic:integrations:sync Magento --first-time-sync --start-datetime="2019-09-12T12:00:00" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Chaining Multiple Filters in Twig DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to chain multiple filters together in Twig, processing content through several transformations in sequence. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-PHP-TO-TWIG-TEMPLATES.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Twig CODE: ``` {{ message|striptags|trans({'%code%': status_code}) }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Trans Filter with Variable Substitution DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the more compact trans filter for translations with variable substitution, and demonstrates filter chaining. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-PHP-TO-TWIG-TEMPLATES.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Twig CODE: ``` {{ message|trans({'%code%': status_code}) }} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Default Filter in Twig Templates DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use Twig's default filter to provide fallback values for variables, making code more concise and readable. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-PHP-TO-TWIG-TEMPLATES.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Twig CODE: ``` Before: {% set nameGetter = nameGetter is defined and nameGetter is not empty ? nameGetter : 'getName' %} After: {% set nameGetter = nameGetter|default('getName') %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Text Replacement with Translation in Twig DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates two approaches for handling variable replacement in translations: using the trans tag with context or using the trans filter with variables. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-PHP-TO-TWIG-TEMPLATES.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: Twig CODE: ``` {% trans with {'%code%': status_code} %}message{% endtrans %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Symfony 2.8 ChoiceType Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example of how to modify ChoiceType implementation to accommodate Symfony 2.8 changes, where choices must use labels as keys and include 'choices_as_values' => true to ensure correct labels and values. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` // Old implementation (Mautic 2.x) $builder->add('field', ChoiceType::class, [ 'choices' => [1 => 'Label1', 2 => 'Label2'] ]); // New implementation (Mautic 3.x) $builder->add('field', ChoiceType::class, [ 'choices' => ['Label1' => 1, 'Label2' => 2], 'choices_as_values' => true ]); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Form Type Class Methods DESCRIPTION: Form type classes need to replace getName() method with getBlockPrefix() method to maintain compatibility with JavaScript files that use form input ID selectors. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` // Old implementation (Mautic 2.x) public function getName() { return 'form_name'; } // New implementation (Mautic 3.x) public function getBlockPrefix() { return 'form_name'; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Form Type Optional Fields DESCRIPTION: Replace deprecated setOptional() method with setDefined() method in form type classes to mark fields as not required but defined. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` // Old implementation (Mautic 2.x) $resolver->setOptional(['field1', 'field2']); // New implementation (Mautic 3.x) $resolver->setDefined(['field1', 'field2']); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Router Usage in PHP Templates DESCRIPTION: Change in router usage for PHP templates, replacing generate() method with url() method for generating URLs. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` // Old implementation (Mautic 2.x) $url = $view['router']->generate('route_name', ['param' => 'value']); // New implementation (Mautic 3.x) $url = $view['router']->url('route_name', ['param' => 'value']); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating ConfigSubscriber in ConfigBundle for PHP DESCRIPTION: Example of how to update the onConfigGenerate method in ConfigSubscribers to include the new 'formType' parameter with the form type class name, while keeping the existing 'formAlias'. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` public function onConfigGenerate(ConfigBuilderEvent $event) { $event->addForm([ 'bundle' => 'EmailBundle', 'formType' => ConfigType::class, 'formAlias' => 'emailconfig', 'formTheme' => 'MauticEmailBundle:FormTheme\Config', 'parameters' => $event->getParametersFromConfig('MauticEmailBundle'), ]); } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring API Rate Limiter Cache in PHP DESCRIPTION: Example of migrating Memcached configuration from Mautic 2.x to 3.x format showing the new adapter-based cache configuration structure. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` 'api_rate_limiter_cache' => array( 'memcached' => array( 'servers' => array( '0' => array( 'host' => 'memcached.local', 'port' => '12345' ) ) ) ), ``` LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` 'api_rate_limiter_cache' => array( 'adapter' => 'cache.adapter.memcached', 'provider' => 'memcached://memcached.local:12345' ), ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Development Hosts in PHP DESCRIPTION: Example showing the change in development hosts configuration from string format to JSON encoded array. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $_SERVER['MAUTIC_DEV_HOSTS'] = '1.2.3.4'; ``` LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $_SERVER['MAUTIC_CUSTOM_DEV_HOSTS'] = '["1.2.3.4"]'; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Database Fixtures Installation in PHPUnit Tests DESCRIPTION: Example showing the change in database fixtures installation syntax from file path to class name based approach. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-3.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $this->installDatabaseFixtures([dirname(__DIR__).'/../../../../../app/bundles/LeadBundle/DataFixtures/ORM/LoadLeadData.php']); ``` LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` $this->installDatabaseFixtures([\Mautic\LeadBundle\DataFixtures\ORM\LeadFieldData::class]); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Fixing Request Parameter Retrieval for Symfony 6 Compatibility DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to modify code to handle array values from request objects in Symfony 6, which requires using the all() method instead of get() when retrieving arrays. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` - $asset = $request->request->get('asset') ?? []; + $asset = $request->request->all()['asset'] ?? []; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating User Login in Functional Tests DESCRIPTION: Shows the new approach to logging in a user in functional tests by first retrieving the user entity from the repository and then passing it to the loginUser method. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` - $user = $this->loginUser('admin'); + $user = $this->em->getRepository(User::class)->findOneBy(['username' => 'admin']); + $this->loginUser($user); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating AJAX Requests in Functional Tests DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the migration from manual AJAX request creation to using the xmlHttpRequest method, including the necessary CSRF header setup for '/s/ajax' endpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` - $this->client->request(Request::METHOD_POST, '/s/ajax', $payload, [], $this->createAjaxHeaders()); + $this->setCsrfHeader(); // this is necessary only for the /s/ajax endpoints. Other ajax requests do not need it. + $this->client->xmlHttpRequest(Request::METHOD_POST, '/s/ajax', $payload); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Asserting Successful Response in Functional Tests DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to replace manual response checking with the more concise assertResponseIsSuccessful method in functional tests. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` $this->client->request('GET', '/s/campaigns/new/'); - $response = $this->client->getResponse(); - Assert::assertTrue($response->isOk(), $response->getContent()); + $this->assertResponseIsSuccessful(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Migrating from SessionInterface to RequestStack DESCRIPTION: Shows how to update code that uses the deprecated SessionInterface to the new RequestStack approach for session access, including constructor injection and method calls. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` - use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Session\SessionInterface; + use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\RequestStack; class NeedsSession { - public function __construct(private SessionInterface $session) {} + public function __construct(private RequestStack $requestStack) {} public function doStuff() { - $selected = $this->session->get('mautic.category.type', 'category'); + $selected = $this->requestStack->getSession()->get('mautic.category.type', 'category'); // ... } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Replacing Doctrine ASC Constants with Enums DESCRIPTION: Shows how to replace deprecated Doctrine ordering constants (Criteria::DESC) with the new enum syntax (Order::Descending->value). SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-6.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: diff CODE: ``` - $q->orderBy($this->getTableAlias().'.dateAdded', \Doctrine\Common\Collections\Criteria::DESC); + $q->orderBy($this->getTableAlias().'.dateAdded', \Doctrine\Common\Collections\Order::Descending->value); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Symfony Messenger Consumer for Email Queue in Mautic 5 DESCRIPTION: Command for starting the Symfony Messenger consumer to process emails in Mautic 5, replacing the previous bin/console mautic:emails:send command. This new approach uses Symfony Messenger to handle email queues in an asynchronous configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` bin/console messenger:consume email ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuration Path Update DESCRIPTION: Replace kernel.root_dir path reference with kernel.project_dir/app due to Symfony 5 deprecation. This affects configuration file paths across the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` %kernel.root_dir% -> %kernel.project_dir%/app ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mailer DSN Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration key change for email transports, replacing all mailer_ prefixed keys with a single mailer_dsn configuration key. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` mailer_* -> mailer_dsn ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Command Usage Update DESCRIPTION: Updated command syntax for broadcast send with limit and batch parameters. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Shell CODE: ``` mautic:broadcast:send --limit=10 --batch=2 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Service Reference Update DESCRIPTION: Updated service reference for HTTP client mock handler in tests. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` self::$container->get(\GuzzleHttp\Handler\MockHandler::class) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Symfony Messenger Reference Command DESCRIPTION: The command 'messenger:consume' replaces the previous 'mautic:queue:process' command for processing queued messages in Mautic 5. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` messenger:consume ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Service Configuration File Path DESCRIPTION: Path to the main services configuration file in Mautic 5 that automatically configures all bundles including plugins for autowiring and autoconfiguration. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` app/config/services.php ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Plugin Services Configuration Path DESCRIPTION: Path pattern for plugin-specific service configuration files that may be needed to exclude folders or files from autowiring or to configure services with special requirements. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-5.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` plugins/*Bundle/Config/services.php ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removed PHP Constant in Dashboard Widget DESCRIPTION: The FORMAT_MYSQL constant has been removed from the Mautic\DashboardBundle\Dashboard\Widget class. Developers should use DateTimeHelper::FORMAT_DB_DATE_ONLY instead for database date formatting. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-7.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` \Mautic\DashboardBundle\Dashboard\Widget::FORMAT_MYSQL ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Alternative PHP Constant for Date Formatting DESCRIPTION: The recommended replacement for the removed FORMAT_MYSQL constant. This constant should be used for date formatting in database queries. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-7.0.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` DateTimeHelper::FORMAT_DB_DATE_ONLY ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Contributors List Table in HTML/Markdown DESCRIPTION: An HTML table embedded in Markdown that displays contributor information including avatars, names, and contribution types using the All Contributors specification format. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```

Dennis Ameling
ðŸ’» ðŸ““
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Contributor Grid in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a table-based grid layout to display contributor information including avatars, names, and contribution types. It uses inline styles for alignment and sizing, and includes links to GitHub profiles and contribution details. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
jos0405
ðŸ’» ðŸ““
Nick Veenhof
ðŸ‘€ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Web Crawler Access Restrictions for Mautic in robots.txt DESCRIPTION: This robots.txt configuration specifies which directories and files should be excluded from search engine indexing. It prevents crawlers from accessing sensitive areas like plugins, application code, user files, and third-party dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: robots.txt CODE: ``` User-agent: * Disallow: /addons/ Disallow: /plugins/ Disallow: /app/ Disallow: /media/dashboards/ Disallow: /media/files/ Disallow: /media/js/mautic-form-src.js Disallow: /themes/ Disallow: /translations/ Disallow: /vendor/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Robots.txt Directives for Mautic DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines the robots.txt rules for a Mautic installation. It specifies directories and files that should not be crawled by search engines, including addon, plugin, app, and media directories, as well as specific JavaScript files and other sensitive areas. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/app/assets/scaffold/files/robots.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: robots.txt CODE: ``` User-agent: * Disallow: /addons/ Disallow: /plugins/ Disallow: /app/ Disallow: /media/dashboards/ Disallow: /media/files/ Disallow: /media/js/mautic-form-src.js Disallow: /themes/ Disallow: /translations/ Disallow: /vendor/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Ignored Paths for Mautic Project DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive list of files and directories to be ignored in the Mautic project. This includes system files, IDE configurations, development environments, test directories, build artifacts, and specific vendor packages that shouldn't be included in version control or deployment processes. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/build/exclude_files.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: gitignore CODE: ``` *.git* *.idea* .ddev/* .DS_Store .env.dist .github/* .gitignore .php-cs-fixer.php .travis.yml codecov.yml Gruntfile.js README.md UPGRADE*.md app/console app/phpunit.xml.dist bin/codecept bin/doctrine bin/doctrine-dbal bin/doctrine-migrations bin/doctrine.php bin/jp.php bin/php-cs-fixer bin/phpstan bin/phpstan.phar bin/phpunit bin/security-checker bin/simple-phpunit build/* modified_files.txt node_modules/* phpstan*.neon rector.php tests/* vendor/babdev/* vendor/liip/* vendor/symfony/browser-kit/* vendor/symfony/dom-crawler/* vendor/symfony/web-profiler-bundle/* vendor/webfactory/* ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Applying GPLv3 License Notice to Source Files DESCRIPTION: A template for adding the GPLv3 license notice to the start of each source file in a program. It includes placeholders for the program name, copyright year, and author name. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see . ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Terminal Interaction Notice for GPLv3 Programs DESCRIPTION: A template for displaying a short notice about the program's copyright and license when it starts in interactive mode. It includes placeholders for the program name, copyright year, and author name. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/LICENSE.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Copyright (C) This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'. This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it under certain conditions; type `show c' for details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Deprecated Mautic Core Bundle Elements in PHP DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the fully qualified names of deprecated elements in the Mautic Core Bundle. It includes a deprecated event constant, a deprecated class, and a deprecated service with its corresponding class. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/UPGRADE-4.3.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: PHP CODE: ``` Mautic\CoreBundle\CoreEvents::ON_FORM_TYPE_BUILD Mautic\CoreBundle\Event\CustomFormEvent 'mautic.form.extension.custom' Mautic\CoreBundle\Form\Extension\CustomFormExtension ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Repository URL in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the URL of the main repository where the FullContact plugin is managed using Markdown syntax for links. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/plugins/MauticFullContactBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/head/plugins/MauticFullContactBundle ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Mautic Social Bundle Repository Information in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This Markdown snippet provides information about the Mautic Social Bundle plugin repository. It includes the plugin name, central management location, and instructions for contributions. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/plugins/MauticSocialBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` # Mautic bundle for Social plugin ## This plugin is managed centrally in https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/head/plugins/MauticSocialBundle and this is a read-only mirror repository. **ðŸ“£ Please make PRs and issues against Mautic Core, not here!** ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Mautic Focus Items Plugin Repository Information in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This Markdown snippet provides information about the Mautic Focus Items plugin bundle. It includes the plugin name, repository management details, and instructions for contributors. SOURCE: https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/7.x/plugins/MauticFocusBundle/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` # Mautic bundle for Focus Items plugin ## This plugin is managed centrally in https://github.com/mautic/mautic/blob/head/plugins/MauticFocusBundle and this is a read-only mirror repository. **ðŸ“£ Please make PRs and issues against Mautic Core, not here!** ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Mautic Cards Theme Repository Information in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet provides information about the Cards theme for Mautic, including its central management location and instructions for contributions.
